interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Ponyo
Review Date: 2014/01/29
Store: Noah Lindsey Cyrus  (Actor),     Frankie Jonas  (Actor),     Hayao Miyazaki  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    G    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Science Fiction & Fantasy, Science Fiction, Animation
Product Description: ['Product Description', "Welcome to a world where anything is possible! Academy Award(R)-winning director Hayao Miyazaki (2002, Best Animated Feature, SPIRITED AWAY) and legendary filmmaker John Lasseter together with Disney bring to life a heartwarming and imaginative telling of Hans Christian Andersen's classic fairy tale THE LITTLE MERMAID. A young boy named Sosuke rescues a goldfish named Ponyo, and they embark on a fantastic journey of friendship and discovery before Ponyo's father, a powerful sorcerer, forces her to return to her home in the sea. In her quest to become human and reunite with Sosuke, Ponyo stumbles upon and releases her father's magical Water of Life and triggers a gigantic storm. Now balance must be restored to the world they all cherish. PONYO will delight your family with its magnificent animation and timeless story. (C) 2009 Nibariki-GNDHDDT(C)2008 Nibariki-(C) Disney", 'Amazon.com', 'Ponyo', 'confirms Academy Award®-winning director Hayao Miyazaki\'s reputation as one of the most imaginative filmmakers working today. Loosely based on Hans Christian Anderson\'s "The Little Mermaid,"', 'Ponyo', "is a magical celebration of innocent love and the fragile beauty of the natural world. The daughter of the sea goddess Gran Mamare (voiced by Cate Blanchett) and the alchemist Fujimoto (Liam Neeson), Ponyo (Noah Cyrus) begins life as an adventurous little goldfish. Chafing at her father's restrictions, she goes in search of adventure and meets Sosuke (Frankie Jonas), a good-natured 5-year-old who lives by the sea. Sosuke adopts Ponyo and quickly wins her heart. Fujimoto uses magic to bring her back, but Ponyo's love for Sosuke proves stronger than his elixirs. She transforms herself into a human girl and returns to him during a spectacular storm at sea, but her metamorphosis upsets the balance of nature, precipitating a crisis only Gran Mamare can resolve.", 'Ponyo', 'contains fantastic moments that suggest dreams-- and reassert the power of hand-drawn animation to create memorable fantasies: No effects-laden Hollywood feature can match the wonder of Ponyo running along the tops of crashing waves on her way back to Sosuke.', 'Ponyo', 'is closer in tone to', 'My Neighbor Totoro', 'than', 'Spirited Away', 'or', "Howl's Moving Castle", ', and will appeal to audiences of all ages, including small children. The #1 film in Japan in 2008,', 'Ponyo', 'earned more than ¥14.9 billion (over US$155 million) to become the 8th highest grossing film in Japanese history. (Rated G: A few scary moments, alcohol use) --', 'Charles Solomon']
Average Rating: 4.8
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Kids & Family, Anime & Manga', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Animated, Color, Dolby, Dubbed, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Matt Damon, Hayao Miyazaki, Cate Blanchett, Liam Neeson, Lily Tomlin, Noah Lindsey Cyrus, Frankie Jonas, Cloris Leachman, Betty White, Tina FeyMatt Damon, Hayao Miyazaki, Cate Blanchett, Liam Neeson, Lily Tomlin, Noah Lindsey Cyrus, Frankie Jonas, Cloris Leachman, Betty White, Tina Fey  See more', 'Language': 'Japanese (Dolby Digital 5.1), English (Dolby Digital 5.1), French, Unqualified', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 43 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.85:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'G (General Audience)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.57 x 5.33 x 7.49 inches; 4.16 Ounces', 'Item model number': '10185400', 'Director': 'Hayao Miyazaki', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Animated, Color, Dolby, Dubbed, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 43 minutes', 'Release date': 'March 2, 2010', 'Actors': 'Noah Lindsey Cyrus, Frankie Jonas, Cate Blanchett, Liam Neeson, Tina Fey', 'Dubbed': 'English, French', 'Subtitles': 'English, French, Spanish', 'Studio': 'Disney Presents Studio Ghibli', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: My daughter loves this story.  She showed the movie to my little neice...and she loved it too!  She couldn't take her eyes off the screen.
Review Title: cute
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------

['Product Description', "Welcome to a world where anything is possible! Academy Award(R)-winning director Hayao Miyazaki (2002, Best Animated Feature, SPIRITED AWAY) and legendary filmmaker John Lasseter together with Disney bring to life a heartwarming and imaginative telling of Hans Christian Andersen's classic fairy tale THE LITTLE MERMAID. A young boy named Sosuke rescues a goldfish named Ponyo, and they embark on a fantastic journey of friendship and discovery before Ponyo's father, a powerful sorcerer, forces her to return to her home in the sea. In her quest to become human and reunite with Sosuke, Ponyo stumbles upon and releases her father's magical Water of Life and triggers a gigantic storm. Now balance must be restored to the world they all cherish. PONYO will delight your family with its magnificent animation and timeless story. (C) 2009 Nibariki-GNDHDDT(C)2008 Nibariki-(C) Disney", 'Amazon.com', 'Ponyo', 'confirms Academy Award®-winning director Hayao Miyazaki\'s reputation as one of the most imaginative filmmakers working today. Loosely based on Hans Christian Anderson\'s "The Little Mermaid,"', 'Ponyo', "is a magical celebration of innocent love and the fragile beauty of the natural world. The daughter of the sea goddess Gran Mamare (voiced by Cate Blanchett) and the alchemist Fujimoto (Liam Neeson), Ponyo (Noah Cyrus) begins life as an adventurous little goldfish. Chafing at her father's restrictions, she goes in search of adventure and meets Sosuke (Frankie Jonas), a good-natured 5-year-old who lives by the sea. Sosuke adopts Ponyo and quickly wins her heart. Fujimoto uses magic to bring her back, but Ponyo's love for Sosuke proves stronger than his elixirs. She transforms herself into a human girl and returns to him during a spectacular storm at sea, but her metamorphosis upsets the balance of nature, precipitating a crisis only Gran Mamare can resolve.", 'Ponyo', 'contains fantastic moments that suggest dreams-- and reassert the power of hand-drawn animation to create memorable fantasies: No effects-laden Hollywood feature can match the wonder of Ponyo running along the tops of crashing waves on her way back to Sosuke.', 'Ponyo', 'is closer in tone to', 'My Neighbor Totoro', 'than', 'Spirited Away', 'or', "Howl's Moving Castle", ', and will appeal to audiences of all ages, including small children. The #1 film in Japan in 2008,', 'Ponyo', 'earned more than ¥14.9 billion (over US$155 million) to become the 8th highest grossing film in Japanese history. (Rated G: A few scary moments, alcohol use) --', 'Charles Solomon']

profile:
**User Profile Summary:**

- **Interest in Animation & Family-Friendly Content:** The user shows a clear preference for animated films, particularly those with magical themes and familial values. They appreciate stories that resonate with children, as evidenced by their focus on content suitable for young audiences.

- **Preference for Quality Storytelling:** The user values films that offer imaginative narratives. They are drawn to works by renowned directors, specifically highlighting animated features from notable filmmakers known for their artistic excellence.

- **Engagement with Children’s Media:** The user's interactions reflect a strong inclination towards selecting films that are not only entertaining but also educational or heartwarming for children, as indicated by their daughter and niece's enjoyment of the film.

- **Positive Attitude towards Content:** The user's rating of the product is high (5.0), which suggests a notable satisfaction with the quality of the content. They likely favor media that elicits joy and engagement from children.

- **Cultural Appreciation:** The choice of a film based on a classic fairy tale signals an appreciation for cultural stories and themes, particularly those that celebrate innocence and the natural world.

Overall, this user is a family-oriented individual who prioritizes high-quality animated films that enchant and educate young viewers, showcasing a strong connection to nurturing children's enjoyment and enrichment through media.
